page.title: 05FARMING TODAY.
page.content: By far the major industry is farming.A great deal of farmland is now arable and worked by huge machines and held on a co-operative share/profit scheme. Only about one quarter of the farms in the area are now farmed by the owners. There is not a great deal of pasture for the animals and grazing left,and what there is is mostly for sheep.Just lately "milking" has been unprofitable and so heds of milking cows have been sold.There is certainly the look of prosperity and fertility about the farms in south Warwickshire,and clearly good yields are harvested.Pig farming is dying out inthe area and of course there are no longer "cottage pigs",so long the dietary standby in the villages,when everyone who could kept one.
